article.description: Another of those 'other' SEC teams -- Vanderbilt -- is headed to Phoenix next week.
article.headline: Fouls, Freije send State packing
article.linkText: Fouls, Frejie send No. 3 NC State packing

inlines.body:
Dick Vitale's Tourney Take
This was a tough loss for North Carolina State coach Herb Sendek and his team. They had a double-digit lead in the second half, but a questionable intentional foul against Marcus Melvin was a major turning point. That sequence led to five points for Vandy and a chance for it to get back into the game. Matt Freije was brilliant for Vandy with 31 points.
More on Sunday's Games

article.story: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- Julius Hodge and Tony Bethel led North Carolina State with 18 points each as the Wolfpack beat Fayetteville State 82-46 in an exhibition game Wednesday night. Hodge, the Atlantic Coast Conference player of the year, hit 7-of-13 shots and added five rebounds. Bethel, a transfer from Georgetown in his first season at State, was 5-for-7 from 3-point range. Reserve Justin Harris was the only player to hit double figures for Division II Fayetteville State, scoring 11 points in 18 minutes.
